ferromtm.models package¶

Submodules¶

ferromtm.models.coupled2D module¶

ferromtm.models.coupled2D.build_incl(fem, r)[source]¶
ferromtm.models.coupled2D.circle(R, x0, y0)[source]¶
ferromtm.models.coupled2D.compute_elstat_pb(fem_es, epsi)[source]¶
ferromtm.models.coupled2D.compute_hom_pb(fem_hom, epsi)[source]¶

Computes the homogenization problem.

Parameters:
  • fem_hom (instance of TwoScale2D class) – The two-scale FEM problem
  • epsi (array-like) – The permittivity tensor diagonal elements, (xx, yy and zz components). Size is (3*nvar) where nvar is the number of points where the permittivity is defined in the FEM model (ie len(fem_hom.des[0])).
Returns:

eps_hom: the permittivity tensor (3*3 numpy array) fem_hom: instance of TwoScale2D class
Return type:

tuple (eps_hom, fem_hom)

ferromtm.models.coupled3D module¶

ferromtm.models.coupled3D.compute_elstat_pb(fem_es, epsi)[source]¶
ferromtm.models.coupled3D.compute_hom_pb(fem_hom, epsi)[source]¶

Computes the homogenization problem.

Parameters:
  • fem_hom (instance of pytheas.homogenization.twoscale3D.femmodel.TwoScale3D class) – The two-scale FEM problem
  • epsi (array-like) – The permittivity tensor diagonal elements, (xx, yy and zz components). Size is (3*nvar) where nvar is the number of points where the permittivity is defined in the FEM model (ie len(fem_hom.des[0])).
Returns:

eps_hom: the permittivity tensor (3*3 numpy array) fem_hom: instance of pytheas.homogenization.twoscale3D.femmodel.TwoScale3D class
Return type:

tuple (eps_hom, fem_hom)
